channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 4 Lights Out, 7th February
item.description:
Four street lights not working on corner of Coburn Gardens. Last one on right coming into the estate, one directly in front, central to garden area and Two as you turn right when coming in. Been like it for a few months now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Brosnan Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Not working, previous case was closed. But not working

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Road works signs at Location for at least last 4 Months, 7th February
item.description:
The location is just into Cleeve Common Road from the Burnt Oak. A road works sign is prone in the field gat and another about 10yards further on. These NOW have to be considered Fly Tip as they have been reported to Highwaysd - NO Response and also to two Road Works Crews who advised they were not theirs (Why not!?) The signs have both been run over and it is about time they were removed as they could cause damage to veihicles if they arte put on to the road AGAIN! Please can they be removed as soon as possible - it is clear from Highways LACK of response that they are abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Bisley Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Half a job, 7th February
item.description:
You filled in one of the holes with a temporary patch repair but left the one right next to it, which is large and has loose scree coming from it. Please return and complete the job!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 King Alfred Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Large craters, 7th February
item.description:
There are extensive numbers of large craters for around 100 yards along Priors Road. The surface is breaking up quite badly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 275 Priors Road, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road works, 6th February
item.description:
This road works has been there for weeks and is causing major traffic problems at busy times. The roundabout at Rutherford Way becomes jammed and stationary, so the traffic flowing past the road works towards the roundabout is also stationary, which means that the traffic waiting to go the other way is unable to move either, as the single lane is full. This in turn makes the congestion at the roundabout worse. It's just unacceptable that this is still going on after so long, with no work being carried out at all. The contractors must be fined for this, and made to remove the blockage until they're ready actually to complete the work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit K2 Manor Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked surface drain by Tythe Barn, 5th February
item.description:
The surface water drain outside the Tythe Barn is blocked and there is a large puddle there despite no rain for several weeks. Cars splash pedestrians on the pavement. When it rains it floods the road and is worse but I have a bigger concern that it has soap suds in it as it’s surface water. I think that the hand car wash in the Kings Head car park just along the road is draining into the surface drain. If you look into the car park you can see the soap suds are going into the Kings Head drain which I imagine feeds into the one outside the Tythe Barn as it’s down hill. Please can you investigate as pedestrians are getting wet and I believe the surface water contaminated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Railway Station Yard Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All street lights out, 3rd February
item.description:
The street lights are out along the whole of Elmfield Road, Elmfield Avenue and Midwinter Avenue. There are elderly people who walk their dogs in the evening and it’s pitch black along the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Elmfield Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
